heading: bargain hunters bid up stocks
subheading: monday the market tanked. tuesday it rebounded as investors bid on bargains. tomorrow, who knows? but big al is speaking before the senate, and that oughta mean something.
author: reuters
text: stocks raced ahead on tuesday as investors rushed back into the market, looking for bargains after the recent battering on nervousness over the outlook for higher interest rates. based on early and unofficial data, the dow jones industrial average ended up 115.88 points, or 1.07 percent, at 10,979.04, clawing back some of last week's loss of 300 points.in the broader market, advancing issues led declines 16 to 13 on moderate volume of 717 million shares on the new york stock exchange.the technology-laced nasdaq composite index jumped 60.50 points, or 2.31 percent, to 2,679.69.investors ran back to stocks after the market was hammered last week by comments from federal reserve chairman alan greenspan that the central bank would move forcefully to prevent any flare-up in inflation. he issued the warnings before the house banking committee.analysts said the trading activity was subdued as investors awaited the second half of greenspan's humphrey-hawkins testimony wednesday before the senate banking committee."there is always a little bit of trepidation about what he is going to say," said harry laubscher, market analyst at tucker anthony & co.among the blue-chip dow stocks that scored big gains on tuesday were american express, up 5 7/8 at 142 3/8 and hewlett-packard, up 3 9/16 at 109 1/16.copyright
